snippet: Grand juries usually hear just the outline of a case, but prosecutors are presenting all their evidence in the Michael Brown shooting, making for a long and exhaustive process.
abstract: St Louis County grand jury is nearing decision on whether to bring criminal charges against Ferguson Police Officer Darren Wilson in fatal shooting of unarmed teen Michael Brown; grand jury proceedings have been highly unusual, in some ways more resembling criminal trial than normal grand jury hearing and shifting heavy responsibility onto 12 jurors.

byline.original: By ERIK ECKHOLM and JULIE BOSMAN

lead_paragraph: Grand juries usually hear just the outline of a case, but prosecutors are presenting all their evidence in the Michael Brown shooting, making for a long and exhaustive process.

headline.main: For Ferguson Grand Jury, Details and Responsibilities Are Abundant
headline.print_headline: For Ferguson Grand Jury, Details and Responsibilities Are Abundant
